intro: Anoumabia, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Anoumabia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and attractive species for botanical study.
